post.body: No yet
not the one I was on anyway. Waiting at heathrow for connection to Glasgow.
that's about 20 degrees less than yesterday in HK. Good job all my warm clothes are still over here!
Stop being in last night, don't you know it's tomorrow already? I mean today... I think...
Off to Gillian's aunt & uncle's for a family dinner.
BTW, I still have my old UK mobile number.
Don't you feel so vindicated when a spare part you kept ages and ages ago saves the day! (Just got my external HDs here back up and running)
Hey everyone, thanks for all the welcome backs. Feels great to be home. It's been a while since I was up at 8am on a Sunday!
Home at last! It is now 24 hours since I woke from a 5 hour sleep. I'm off to bed. Goodnight!
It's dreech, but it's good to be home. Weird though: everything is so normal it feels like I've only been away a couple of days.
Heading back to kilmarnock, stopping off to say hi to parents, then home.
Landed in Glasgow, an hour and a half late. No doubt baggage will now take an age to appear.
Almost an embarassing moment when I forgot that WH Smith wouldn't accept payment by octopus card.
Great, flight to Glasgow delayed until 6. :-( The whole airport experience in UK is amateur hour compared to HK, which couldn't be slicker.
No gate information for the flight which is due to take off in 15 mins. Doesn't bode well.. :-/
I'm totally shattered. Traveling back in time is tough.
Not often London feels like 'nearly home'
In London, feel like crap. Wonder how much this roaming data costs...
Just boarding, here comes 14 hours of boredom. See you all on the other side.
Trying to find some breakfast at the airport that isn't burgers or noodles
